intro: Parsonsia sanguinea var. millikenii, commonly known as the Milliken’s flame vine, is a striking tropical plant native to parts of Australia. It is characterized by its vibrant orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a climbing shrub that can grow up to several meters in height, using its twining stems to support itself. The botanical features of this variety make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
